intro: Terminalia ombrophila, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Combretaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and alternate, simple leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by woody, capsule-like fruits containing flat, disc-shaped seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated for horticultural purposes.
